explanation: The close symbols include standard memory allocation functions malloc and free, which are used to allocate and free memory pools. The mhd_assert macro/function is used for runtime checks. The macros MAP_ANONYMOUS and _WIN32 control platform-specific memory mapping code. MHD_sys_page_size_ is used for page size alignment. mmap and VirtualAlloc functions are platform-specific memory allocators. ROUND_TO_ALIGN and ALIGN_SIZE are used for size alignment and must be understood to confirm how memory size is computed. _MHD_POISON_MEMORY is used to initialize or mark memory after allocation. These symbols are all needed to fully understand memory allocation and initialization in MHD_pool_create and to verify if there could be any hidden use of memcmp when comparing null terminated strings. Since memcmp is not directly called here, understanding these supporting symbols ensures there is no indirect or hidden violation related to string comparison.
